meanings.sent1: The prearrangements for the party included setting up decorations and ordering food.
meanings.sent2: She always makes prearrangements for her travel to ensure a smooth trip.
meanings.sent3: The prearrangements for the surprise party were almost ruined when the guest of honor almost found out.
meanings.sent4: His prearrangements for retirement involved saving money diligently for years.
meanings.sent5: The prearrangements for the wedding made everything run like clockwork on the big day.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The prearrangements of the seating plan made the event flow seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: Before the event, the prearrangements of the schedule were carefully organized.
meanings.sent3: The prearrangements of the surprise party were so secretive that even the neighbors didn't suspect a thing.
meanings.sent4: Her prearrangements of the project were like a well-choreographed dance, with every detail in its place.
meanings.sent5: The prearrangements of the meeting ensured that everything was ready before the participants arrived.
